title: Webpack 5.22. `compiler.modifiedFiles` is undefined in watch build when config is an array.
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**
I've got a webpack plugin which reads modified files from the `compiler.modifiedFiles`. When the webpack config  is an array, then the `modifiedFiles` is `undefined` when the plugins tap callback is called after a file change.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
see the minimal reproduction repo: https://github.com/mbehzad/webpack-modified-files-issue
i.e. 
```javascript
// webpack.config.js

class SomePlugin {
  apply(compiler) {
    compiler.hooks.emit.tap("SomePlugin", (compilation) => {
        // is always `undefined`
        console.log(compiler.modifiedFiles);
    });
  }
}

module.exports = [
  {
    entry: {
      A: "./main.js",
    },
    mode: "development",
    plugins: [new SomePlugin()],
  },
  {
    entry: {
      B: "./main.js",
    },
    mode: "development",
  },
];

```

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**
I would assume the `modifiedFiles` property has the list of changed files regardless of plugin being part of a multi webpack config or a single one.


<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.24.0
webpack-cli: 4.5.0
Node.js version: 14.15.0
Operating System: Windows 10

(**might** be relevant information) There were some changes in PR #12671 namely in [Watching.js:91](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/472385eb9e0415b1fd7c0a442be3fb23694a4b6c/lib/Watching.js#L91): 
`this.compiler.modifiedFiles = watcher.aggregatedChanges;`
but the `watcher` is the returned object from NodeWatchFileSystem.js's watch method ([NodeWatchFileSystem.js:89](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/472385eb9e0415b1fd7c0a442be3fb23694a4b6c/lib/node/NodeWatchFileSystem.js#L89)) not the reference to the `watchpack`'s watcher instance. maybe that leads to changes being always undefined?
